intro: Vernonia woytkowskii, commonly known as the Woytkowski's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically blue to purple in color. Vernonia woytkowskii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
